xeto.libraries.sys.markdownDescription: Specifies the GIT **sha** for the desired version of sys libraries. The content of the libraries will be download from GH based on the provided **sha**.

xeto.libraries.external.markdownDescription:
A list of locations for external libraries.
The entries can be either: 
* strings
   * this needs to be a path to the local file system that vscode can access
  * if the folder contains a **lib.xeto** file then it is treated as a single library
  * if **lib.xeto** is missing, then each folder (just one level deep) is searched and considered a lib if **lib.xeto** exists
  * anything else is ignored
* an object that describes the desired library. This is mostly used for **URLs**. The object should have the following structure
   * **name**: name of the lib
   * **lib**: URL path to **lib.xeto** file. Version and docs will be read from this
   * **files**: a string array with the URL to all the files of the lib

 Example of a lib entry: 
 
{
 "name": "fakelib",
 "lib": "https://ex.com/fakelib/lib.xeto",
  "files": [
   "https://ex.com/fakelib/meta.xeto"
   "https://ex.com/fakelib/tags.xeto"
 ]
}
 
In case of name clashing libraries at **the top** of the array take precedence over libraries of the same name but **lower** in the array.
